alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 2:48PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm cluster will impact areas near Petrified Forest National Park and southern portions of Navajo Nation near I- 40 through 330 PM MST /430 MDT/... At 244 PM MST /344 MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles east of Woodruff, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall, winds of up to 40 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain may result in ponding or minor flooding, especially across portions of I-40 and U.S. Highway 180. Locations impacted include... Southern portions of Navajo Nation, Petrified Forest National Park, Petrified Forest N.P. Visitors Center and Petrified Forest N.P. Headquarters. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 298 and 324. Highway 180 between mile markers 318 and 339. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264
